chapter.para: &stiga; stands for &stig;. The &disa; (&disaa;) organization, which is a parent agency of the United States Department of Defense (DoD), approves and publishes &stig;s (&stiga;s) and updates them every 90 days.

When a &stig; is implemented for a system, the system is hardened. The goals are to minimize attacks and to prevent system access (both physically and via a network) and to define processes for maintenance (applying software updates) and vulnerability patching. &stig;s can also cover configuration settings, for example, for operating systems, routers, databases, firewall rules, domain name servers and switches.
